reviews.review_msg: Sean was a very caring prof, though this course was intersession, Sean delivered this course in a very caring and respectable manner. He was always open to talk if you needed it and overall created a good environment to learn in. I would strongly recommend Sean if you're taking a course in REM

Great prof. Puts his own experience and study into the lectures beyond the material. Quite a bit of reliance on his slides, but he does use videos and other media. Tutorials fun, related and not your usual regurgitation of readings!
Great prof, kept course interesting even if material was extremely dull. Courseware was boring but his lecture notes were great and easy to follow. Very engaging and truly dedicated to teaching.

Sean is fantastic as he always tries to engage you even when you're about about to sleep. He's passionate about issues regarding the environment and is really infectious. No Final with two mid-terms that are really easy. DON'T BUY THE COURSEWARE. Term paper was a drag so start on it right away. Class average on the term project was an A-.
Sean is a great proff and a nice guy. He is engaging.  The lecture notes were clear and concise.  However, marks were not spread out properly. Everything at the end of the term was worth too much.

This class was brutal. Content was what was expected but prob is not a good teacaher and it shows. All the marks were alloted at the end of the semester and not spread out well. There was no final just a paper so you don't even have to attent the last 4 weeks of lectures. Overall the lectures were boring and all of the work was due at the end of th
First off....very hot prof ;) the class is horrible, but the prof is great...is very engaging...tutorials were excellent...somewhat tough marker for being a easy going guy
Really, one of the worst professors I've had at SFU. I am taking distance ed for SCD from now on.

A commendable teacher! Does his best to help his students understand his course material and "the bigger picture". Extremely helpful when it comes to understanding the readings. Unfortunately, the content is a bit dry so it can make lectures quite long. Overall, sweet professor who tries his best to be engaging and informative.

Sean is an excellent professor with a fun teaching style that keeps lecture interesting.  One of the best classes I've had despite not being that into the material - I highly recommend taking a class with him!

Overall, course material is a bit dry but clear, although it seems to be very general information.
 Has timed mid-terms, so make sure you are a fast writer cause theres no time to think.  No outlines for presentations or papers.
